sentences.en: Alliott told Singleton he was passing the sentence prescribed by law.
sentences.cn: 阿利奥特告诉辛格尔顿他是依法判决。

sentences.en: Before sentence was passed, Mr Mills escaped from jail.
sentences.cn: 在宣判前，米尔斯先生越狱了。

sentences.en: He has just begun a life sentence for murder.
sentences.cn: 他犯了谋杀罪，刚开始服无期徒刑。

sentences.en: He stood emotionless as he heard the judge pass sentence.
sentences.cn: 他面无表情地站在那里，听法官宣布判决。

sentences.en: he was under sentence of death.
sentences.cn: 他被判处死刑。

sentences.en: His nine-month sentence was overturned by Appeal Court judge Lord Justice Watkins.
sentences.cn: 上诉法院法官沃特金斯撤销了对他作出的9个月徒刑的判决。

sentences.en: His original death sentence was commuted to life in prison.
sentences.cn: 他最初的死刑被减为终身监禁。

sentences.en: His voice dropped at the end of the sentence.
sentences.cn: 到句子结尾处，他压低了嗓音。

sentences.en: I was resigned to serving out the sentence.
sentences.cn: 我只能服满刑期。

sentences.en: If he is caught again he will be given a custodial sentence.
sentences.cn: 如果他再次被捕，将会被处以监禁。

sentences.en: In a case of premeditated murder a life sentence is mandatory.
sentences.cn: 蓄意杀人依法要判无期徒刑。

sentences.en: Nothing other than an immediate custodial sentence could be justified.
sentences.cn: 只有判决即时监禁才算合理。

sentences.en: Sanchez was sentenced to three years in prison.
sentences.cn: 桑切斯被判了三年监禁。

sentences.en: She received an eight-year prison sentence.
sentences.cn: 她被判八年徒刑。

sentences.en: Take, for example, the simple sentence: "The man climbed up the hill"
sentences.cn: 以Themanclimbedupthehill这个简单句为例。

sentences.en: The Bishop said he was sickened by the severity of the sentence.
sentences.cn: 主教说他对如此重的量刑大为震惊。

sentences.en: The court is expected to pass sentence later today.
sentences.cn: 预计法院今天晚些时候会宣布判决。

sentences.en: The judge has passed a sentence on the prisoner.
sentences.cn: 法官已对犯人做出判决。

sentences.en: The offences carry a maximum sentence of 10 years.
sentences.cn: 这些罪行最高可判10年徒刑。

sentences.en: This sentence is totally disproportionate to the alleged offence.
sentences.cn: 从所犯罪行来看，这一量刑完全不合理。

sentences.en: You must serve out your sentence.
sentences.cn: 你现在必须服从你的判决。

sentences.en: Your task is to interchange words so that the sentence makes sense.
sentences.cn: 你们要做的就是调换单词的位置以使句子意义通顺。

words.tran_cn: 宣判,判决,判罪,宣告有罪

trans.tran_en: a group of words that usually contains a subject and a verb, and expresses a complete idea. Sentences written in English begin with a capital letter and usually end with a  full stop  or a  question mark
if a judge sentences someone who is guilty of a crime, they give them a punishment
a punishment that a judge gives to someone who is guilty of a crime
if a judge sentences someone who is guilty of a crime, they give them a punishment
